title: Mouth Wash Tumber (matte Surface), "Muslin glass set", 1891
medium: Mouth-blown crystal, hand painted gold, and engraving
provenance: This set was ordered for use at gala dinners to replace the glasses of set No. 100 "Leaf cut," which were becoming too expensive. Empress Elisabeth strongly preferred the dainty design of this beautiful set.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description:
Mouth-blown crystal, hand-painted gold rims and engraved Habsburg crest
Originally used together with a matching bowl to rinse out the mouth with water.

participants.person_name: J. & L. Lobmeyr GmbH, Vienna, Austria
J. & L. Lobmeyr GmbH, Vienna, Austria

tombstone.epitaph:
Mouth Wash Tumber (matte Surface), "Muslin glass set", 1891.
1891. Mouth-blown crystal, hand painted gold, and engraving. Museum purchase through gift of Dale and Doug Anderson, Anonymous Donor, Arthur Liu, and Prairie Pictures, Inc. and from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 2009-18-14.
